revised_title: Surgical Treatment of Bubonocele (Groin Rupture) and the Role of Omentum
tldr: The author describes a case of bubonocele (groin rupture) in a 70-year-old woman and the surgical procedure performed to repair it. The operation involved reducing the hernial bag and removing the omentum, which played a significant role in the strangulation of the gut. The patient recovered well after the procedure, and the author emphasizes the importance of early intervention in such cases.
